snippet: Voices inside and outside Scotland are warning of the implications of leaving the United Kingdom, even as supporters say Scotland would be better off by itself.
abstract: Scots remain deeply divided as referendum on independence from Great Britain approaches, with spread narrowing to just three percentage points in April; business leaders and economists warn that Scotland will not have financial strength to prosper on its own; nationalists argue that British government is far too conservative and has pushed austerity on a Scottish government that never wanted it.
lead_paragraph: Voices inside and outside Scotland are warning of the implications of leaving the United Kingdom, even as supporters say Scotland would be better off by itself.

headline.main: Scots Are Divided Over Independence, and Its Economic Costs
headline.print_headline: Scots Are Divided Over Independence, and Its Economic Costs
